intro: Hemizonia virgata var. heermannii, commonly known as the Heermann's hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Its botanical structure supports its adaptation to drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
